metadata.title: CVE-2021-29923 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Go before 1.17 does not properly consider extraneous zero characters at thebeginning of an IP address octet, which (in some situations) allowsattackers to bypass access control that is based on IP addresses, becauseof unexpected octal interpretation. This affects net.ParseIP andnet.ParseCIDR.

criterions.comment: golang: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.10 package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
